pageProps.content:
![Chodang Dubu Village (Ï¥àÎãπÎëêÎ∂ÄÎßàÏùÑ)](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365229_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Just south of Gyeongpo Beach is Chodang Dubu Village, which is famous for dubu (tofu). Along Gangneung's most famous food street the beans are ground for Chodang dubu, then through several steps, salt water from the East Sea is used in the congealing process resulting in a soft and light tofu. The name of this village, Chodang, originates from the name of a famous family that once lived here known as Chodang-Heoyeop. Heoyeop was the father of son, writer/poet Heo-gyun [1569~1618] and daughter, poet Heonan-seolheon [1563~1589]. A traditional-style Korean house has been reconstructed on the site where the original house of Heo-gyun and Heonan-seolheon once stood. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(English, Korean, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-33-640-4414| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/1022426_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/1022426_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/203503_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/203503_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365224_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365224_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365225_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365225_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365226_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365226_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365227_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365227_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365228_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/2365228_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658741907055/551894_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658741907055/551894_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-640-4414](tel:+82336404414) - [üè†gnchodangdubu.modoo.at](http://gnchodangdubu.modoo.at) ```googleMap latitude: 37.7931115115 longitude: 128.9170802756 title: 99, Chodangsundubu-gil, Gangneung-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions Bus
 From Gangneung Intercity Bus Terminal, take bus 206, 207 or 230. (40min-ride)
Get off at Gangneung High School and walk 5 min.

Taxi
 From Gangneung Terminal or Gangneung Station, it takes 15-20 min. by taxi.

data.title: Chodang Dubu Village (Ï¥àÎãπÎëêÎ∂ÄÎßàÏùÑ)
data.description: Just south of Gyeongpo Beach is Chodang Dubu Village, which is famous for dubu (tofu).  Along Gangneung's most famous food street the beans are ground for Chodang dubu, then through several steps, salt water from the East Sea is used in the congealing process resulting in a soft and light tofu.  The name of this village, Chodang, originates from the name of a famous family that once lived here known as Chodang-Heoyeop.  Heoyeop was the father of son, writer/poet Heo-gyun 1569~1618  and daughter, poet Heonan-seolheon 1563~1589 .  A traditional-style Korean house has been reconstructed on the site where the original house of Heo-gyun and Heonan-seolheon once stood.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Paroho Lake (Hwacheon) (ÌååÎ°úÌò∏(ÌôîÏ≤ú))
dataList.description: Paroho Lake is a manmade lake created when Hwacheon Dam was built in the valley of the Bukhangang River. The lake was once referred to as Daebungho Lake for its resembling image of an imaginary phoenix rising with its wings spread wide open when seen from afar. The area was a territory of North Korea after Koreas independence, but became a South Korean territory after the Korean War.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Pak Kyongni House (Î∞ïÍ≤ΩÎ¶¨Î¨∏ÌïôÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Pak Kyongni House is a place to explore the life and works of  prominent novelist Pak Kyongni. The houses theme was based on Pak Kyongnis well-known novel Toji (The Land).The site used to be her old house before it was converted into a park. Covering an area of 10,578.51 „é°, the garden and the house have been maintained in their original state. The park also features three themed areas recreated from the book  Hongi Dongsan, Pyeongsa-ri Madang, and Yongdurebeol.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Osaek Mineral Spring (Ïò§ÏÉâÏïΩÏàòÌÑ∞)
dataList.description: Osaek Mineral Spring is situated 20 kilometers west of Yangyang and 7.5 kilometers southeast from Hangyeryeong Pass. The water, which springs from three base rocks by a brook, is carbonated and rich in iron. Up to 1,500 liters of iron-rich water spring out on a daily basis. Osaek became well known due to the splendid landscape leading up to the mineral spring and its location on the way to the summit of Seoraksan Mountain.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Osaek Jujeongol Valley (Ïò§ÏÉâÏ£ºÏ†ÑÍ≥®)
dataList.description: This valley in Seoraksan National Park is located on the way from Osaek-ri, Yangyang-gun, to Osaengnyeong (Hangyeryeong) Pass. It is the most famous place for fall colors in Seoraksan Mountain, and its handsome valley and rock formations are well-known as well. Its name, Jujeongol, is said to come from the Joseon-era bandits that are said to have settled in the area, making their living with counterfeit (ju) coins (jeon) while disguised as Buddhist monks. Osaek (meaning ‚Äúfive colors‚Äù) was inspired by the five colors of Jujeongol‚Äôs rock formations, and the five-colored tree that is said to have lived in Osaekseoksa Temple of the past. A 3.2 km-long trail brings visitors along the rising rocks next to the valley, connecting Seongguksa Temple and Seonnyeotang Pothole to Yongso Falls Information Center. It is a relatively flat, 1 hr-long course with many wooden decks that help to make it more accessible for the visitors. The entrance to the trail is the location of the Osaek Mineral Spring, whose natural carbonation and iron content impart a unique flavor in the water. Keep your eyes open for strange rock formations like Gorae, Sangtu, and Bubu Rocks, as well as Namseorak‚Äôs famous sights like Seonnyeotang Pothole, Geumgangmun Gate, and Yongso Falls.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ojukheon House (Í∞ïÎ¶â Ïò§Ï£ΩÌóå)
dataList.description:
Ojukheon House was where Yi I (penname Yulgok; scholar and politician of the Joseon Period) was born. It was built during the early Joseon dynasty and was designated as Treasure No. 165 in 1963 for its historical value.

Inside the house is Mongryongsil, where Yi I was born. The household complex also features the household shrine, Munseongsa, the sarangchae (mens quarters), Eojaegak Pavilion, Yulgok Memorial Hall, and Gangneung Municipal Museum. Since 1961, the city of Gangneung has held a memorial ceremony at Yulgok Memorial Hall on October 25-26.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Odaesan National Park (Ïò§ÎåÄÏÇ∞Íµ≠Î¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Odaesan Mountain is located in the central and eastern part of Gangwon-do. The mountain was designated a national park in February 1975, including an area of 298.5 „é¢ centered on the highest peak, Birobong Peak (alt. 1,563 meters). Other peaks include Horyeongbong, Sangwangbong, Dongdaesan, and Durobong.

Odaesan Mountain has the largest natural forest of Korea, home to many wild animals and plants. The mountain is divided into smaller sections Odaesan Section, Bangadari Bridge Section, Byeongnae-ri Section, Hwangbyeongsan Mountain Section, Hongcheon-myeon Section, and Sogeumgang River Section. It is also rich in soil and resources, with lush forests and gentle slopes.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: National Center for Forest Activities Chuncheon (Íµ≠Î¶ΩÏ∂òÏ≤úÏà≤Ï≤¥Ïõê)
dataList.description: National Center for Forest Activities Chuncheon is 335 ha of area located near Samhangol Valley. The center has a slogan PLAY meaning P for Play, L for Lead, A for Act, and Y for You. Various facilities are available including area for experience programs, accommodations, restaurants and more. Experience programs for individuals and groups are available as well as special programs for people with disabilities and elderlies.
dataList.author: korea-tour
